actions-list.actionItem: The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H.R. 1163.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 2 and H.R. 1163. The resolution provides for consideration of H.R. 2 under a closed rule with five hours of general debate, and the resolution provides for consideration of H.R. 1163 under a closed rule with one hour of general debate. The resolution provides for a motion to recommit on each measure.
Considered under the provisions of rule H. Res. 383. H.R. 1163 — "To provide incentives for States to recover fraudulently paid Federal and State unemployment compensation, and for other purposes."

The Chair put the question on the agreeing to motion to recommit and by voice vote announced the noes had prevailed. Ms. Garcia (TX) demanded the yeas and nays, and the Chair postoned further proceedings until a time to be announced.
Ms. Garcia (TX) moved to recommit to the Committee on the Judiciary.
The previous question was ordered pursuant to the rule.
The House resumed with further debate on H.R. 2.
Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 2 — "To secure the borders of the United States, and for other purposes."
Pursuant to clause 1(c) of rule XIX, the Chair announced that consideration of H.R 2 would now resume.
The House proceeded with one minute speeches, which by direction of the Chair, would be limited to 15 minutes per side of the aisle.
The Chair designated Mr. Tiffany to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal.  Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by the House Chaplain, Chaplain Margaret Grun Kibben.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of May 11.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is scheduled for 11:00 a.m. today.
The House proceeded with Morning-Hour Debate. At the conclusion of Morning-Hour, the House will recess until 11:00 a.m. for the start of legislative business.
The Speaker designated the Honorable C. Scott Franklin to act as Speaker pro tempore for today.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
